Wonderful expansion to HL1. Very short but fun game. Needs a HD remaster.

Out of the half-life, half-life opposing force, and half-life blue shift, this game comes in third. It's shorter and there aren't any new weapons, however, it was still fun. Playing through the same event through three different perspectives is really cool. If you have to choose between opposing force and blue shift, go for opposing force. If you can get both, get both.

FANTASTIC! play from the perspective of barney the security guard! your friend Otis is waiting for you! Play it! 10/10 get more lore on what happens on the other side of the facility when the brown stuff hits the fan!

Es una expansión digna del juego original, mantiene el mismo gameplay y la misma forma de contar la historia. La idea de ponernos en los zapatos de un guardia de seguridad me gustó personalmente. La historia es buena, no tanto como el juego original, pero cuenta cosas interesantes. La IA puede tener algunos fallos, pero se siente decente. Las armas son las mismas de Half Life, lo cual puede ser un problema si te gusta la variedad. Un detalle es que es un poco corto, yo me lo pasé en menos de 2 horas, ya que fui a lo loco, normalmente dura 4 horas aproximadamente, siempre que vayas tranquilamente y prestando atención a los detalles. Totalmente recomendado, si te gustó Half Life, te gustará Blue Shift.

Довольно не плохое дополнение, к первой части Халвы, хоть и короткое

Una expansion que nos muestra como era sobrevivir si nada mas que suerte, este es el camino que le toco a Barney tras quedar atrapado en Black Mesa y su resonancias de Cascadas, ademas de tener unos de lo finales a mi parecer, que da a gusto, lastima que no haya añadido de armas como en Opposing Force, o que el juego es mas corto de lo que parece, pero aun asi es una excelente expansion para todos los fans.

Another great add-on for another great game. Half-Life: Blue Shift drops you into Black Mesa as one of the most iconic characters from the Half-Life series, Barney Calhoun. Starting out as a security guard at the facility, you witness the events of Gordon Freeman's accident and the chaos that ensues once the portal is opened. Highly recommend if you're finishing the original game or Opposing Force, or if you just love the series as a whole.
Honestly, it's a bit of a letdown following [i]Opposing Force[/i]. Still good, though.

Not too shabby for a game you can beat easily in just three hours. Despite being made by Gearbox just like Opposing Force was, I think Blue Shift is the better of the two, because the level design and gameplay is a lot more tolerable in general. In OpFor the combat is awful, because the balance between the player and the enemies is almost nonexistent. In OpFor enemies will hitscan you to death whilst simultaneously being massive bullet sponges. Every firefight seemed like a practice in save-scumming. This game feels a lot more 'natural' in comparison. I don't remember ever buying this but it's been in my library for ages so if you somehow have this, it's a fun romp through some classic Half-Life-style stuff despite its ultra-brief runtime.

This game is okay.

I got this when the valve pack was on sale, and when it's on sale it's definitely worth your money. But for $5 it's a bit steep. I did a playthrough on hard for the first time and beat it in 3 hours (says 8 because I forgot to close it last night), but I bet I could've been quicker. You only see the old enemies, barely some of them in fact, and no new ones or bosses. You get a limited slew of weapons unlike the original Half Life. The lore is kinda boring and adds nothing new to it besides a backstory to a character in the later games. It's mostly gunplay and no jump-boost, few puzzles to work with.

Now I don't want to say it's bad, it's still fun, but it's short and much less than the original Half-Life.

Overall, I give this a 6/10. Gameplay is good as always and has some charm of the original, but lacks a good story, has few puzzles (which are fun, but not many), limited enemies & guns, and overall short. Get it on sale or with Valve pack, it is not worth $5.

Bardzo dobry dodatek do gry half life. Warto zauważyć, że do Half Life Blue Shift i Opposing Force nie jest wymagana podstawowa wersja Half life. W tym dodatku wcielamy się w strażnika strefy laboratorium Black Mesa Barneya Calhouna, który pomagał Gordonowi Freemanowi w osiągnięciu celu. Na przejście potrzebujemy około 3 godzin bez żadnego spinania się. Akcja rozgrywa się równolegle z historią Gordona i dzięki temu możemy zobaczyć różne akcje Freemana z oczu Barneya. Jak najbardziej polecam :)

Expansión de Half-Life donde eres Barney Calhoun, el amigo de Gordon Freeman, y en el que puedes completar la historia de Black Mesa. Recomendado, se termina rápido.

Mod o juego a parte, o DLC, como quieras llamarlo. Tiene puzzles bastante ingeniosos, hay uno especialmente que me pareció bastante rebuscado y super creativo a la vez. Muy corto, no creo que te dure más de cuatro horas, si te quedas demasiado atascado con algunos puzzles, pero este juego a día de hoy lo puedes comprar a un precio extremadamente barato, así que no veo por que ser tacaño, aún así cuando no incluye ni cromos ni logros, es un mod que encuentro que está bastante bueno. Lo único de lo que me quejo, es la dificultad, ya que la distribución de recursos está bastante rota, y eso de que estoy un 90% seguro de que lo termine en dificultad difícil.

This game and the original Half-Life have been causing me a lot of blue screens, but it doesn't stop me. It does make sure I save a lot though, thanks blue screen! This game is great and I recommend buying and playing it.

This is a small expansion to Half Life 1, so don't play this unless you have played HL1 first. HL: Blue Shift is quite short, only around 2-3 hours long, but a great game with good content. 

The story is great, and interesting to experience the disintegrating world from a different perspective as a regular security guard. There isn't much else to say, just that you are playing as a regular dude doing his normal job, but one day the world is coming to an end and you have to fight to survive. If you liked the Half Life game-play and story and want to experience more, this is a great option.

While the game is fun, I would only recommend getting Blue Shift if you're desperate for more Half-Life. The game only takes around 2-3 hours to beat and the difficulty is far below that of the previous two installments (I beat it on hard and didn't even come close to the amount of deaths/reloads that I did in HL1 and Opposing Force). However it still plays exactly the same as the previous games and that alone makes the game fun enough for any fans of the series, it just isn't anything amazing.
Doesn't have any new weapons or enemies like OPFOR, but is overall a significantly more polished experience.

Probably the most lacking of the OG Half-Life games. Despite it being slightly lackluster compared to the others, still a solid and fun game

This game does not feature Taiga Saejima

So, this expansion is probably the most copy paste feeling compared to Opposing Force that came before it. I very much enjoyed Half-Life Blue Shift despite it being shorter than both the base Half-Life and Opposing Force. For this expansion, yet another new protagonist is introduced. Barney Calhoun, a security officer of the Black Mesa research facility. Unfortunately unlike the base Half-Life where he's an NPC you can get dialogue from, he's silent in this expansion. Main characters...*sigh*. That was a wasted opportunity but what can you do? Just like my reviews of the previous expansion and base game, to follow along with the story for yourself, get this expansion too.
i actually had more fun playing this than i had playing opposing force but that is just my experience! :)

This little episode escaped my attention for a long time, but it was super fun. For me it ages pretty well, minus a little janky platforming. Really fun gun play as long as you disable auto aim, and a cute little half life story.

Отличная, коротенькая игра по вселенной half life, которая проходится очень быстро. Конкретно эту игру уже можно 100% назвать дополнением, так как контента здесь меньше, чем в opossing force и основной игре. 
Начну свой обзор с плюсов:
-Сюжет. Тоже средний, но намного лучше, чем в основной игре.
-Отличный саундтрэк, из-за которого могут пойти мурашки. Композиторы поработали на ура.
-Уровни. Здесь они не такие затянутые, как в основной игре.
Минусы:
-Когда загружаешь сейв, то персонаж начинает всегда сам стрелять. И это можно исправить только, если быстро нажать на какую-нибудь цифру.
-Возможность просто так умереть, когда не можешь куда-то пройти.
Рекомендую всем поиграть в эту игру.
Half life blue shift is cool. its cool to see refences to the first half life like when freeman gets captured.

My review for Half-Life: Blue Shift

The game is 10/10 amazing that I've played. It gives a view on how Barney Calhoun survived Black Mesa along with other Scientist Survivors. The puzzles were challenging, good combat, and new Characters. I'm 100% positive and sure this is canon/connected to Half-Life and it's other expansions like Gordon Freeman being seen 3 times, Adrian Shephard being mentioned, and seeing Gina Cross in the security cameras.

I recommend this game.
Short but interesting. After all, it's Half Life!
